content:
The "Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995" is established to create a project for rural telemedicine. The "Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995" establishes up to 10 pilot projects to investigate the use of rural health care provider telemedicine networks for physician consultative services under Medicare in rural areas. The "Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995" establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in rural areas, serving physicians and clinics through agreements with tertiary care providers for patient referral and joint communications systems. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in rural areas. These networks involve agreements with multispecialty tertiary care providers for patient referral, joint communications systems, and transportation services within the network. The network operates in designated rural health professional shortage areas or underserved rural areas as specified by the Secretary. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in rural areas, involving agreements with multispecialty tertiary care providers for patient referral, joint communications systems, and transportation services within the network. The network operates in designated rural health professional shortage areas or underserved rural areas as specified by the Secretary. Medicare payment for participants is addressed in Section 3. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in rural areas. The Secretary shall make payments from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for physicians' services in rural areas, regardless of location. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in rural areas. Payments will be made for physician consultative services, even if the provider is not at the same location as the beneficiary. The Secretary will determine payment amounts based on available funds and include payment for signal transmission facilities. Payments may also be made for nonphysician providers. The methodology involves making payments for signal transmission facilities for physician consultative services. Payments can also be made for nonphysician providers. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF NETWORKS. Networks eligible for the pilot project must submit an application with required information and agree to provide necessary data to the Secretary. The term "rural area" is defined in the Act. The pilot project requires networks to submit necessary information to the Secretary for payment determination and reporting. The term "rural area" is defined in the Act. SEC. 5. CRITERIA FOR SELECTING PARTICIPANTS.

In selecting eligible networks for pilot projects, priority is given to networks facilitating consultations between patients and specialists through detailed data transmission. Existing networks can also participate.

SEC. 6. REPORTS. The Secretary must submit an interim report to Congress within 24 months of making payments for pilot project services, detailing participating projects and networks, expenses, and patient numbers. A final report must be submitted within 1 year after project termination, including cost-effectiveness analysis and success in provider access promotion. The Secretary must submit a final report to Congress on the operation of telemedicine projects, including cost-effectiveness analysis, impact on patient care quality, and recommendations for changes in the Medicare program. The Secretary must submit a final report to Congress on telemedicine projects, including cost-effectiveness analysis, impact on patient care quality, and recommendations for changes in the Medicare program, such as estimates of associated costs. Authorization of appropriations from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for a total of $51,000,000 for a demonstration project under this Act, with up to $1,000,000 allowed for administrative purposes.
